ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Okay...new term (to me) de-levelling?
ygData.msgSnippet: I looked into it and Verant indeed is smarter than that. Keith ... From: mackmillan@yahoo.com [mailto:mackmillan@yahoo.com] Sent: Tuesday, April 24, 2001 3:57
ygData.messageBody:
I looked into it and Verant indeed is smarter than that.
 
Keith
-----Original Message-----
From: mackmillan@... [mailto:mackmillan@...]
Sent: Tuesday, April 24, 2001 3:57 PM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Okay...new term (to me) de-levelling?


On Mon, 23 Apr 2001, Paul Martin wrote:

> Your skills stay where they are at when you lose a level. On the PvP
> servers, imagine a lvl 5 rogue with the skills and abilities of a lvl 55.


Anyone know if you can play the same game with training points?   If I
recall correctly, you get 5 points to train with for every level.  If you
lose a level and gain it again, do you get another 5 points?  I'm guessing
Verant would be smarter than that.  But what about gaining a level, going
and spending your 5 points, then losing and re-gaining the level again.
Just something I'm curious about, anyone tested it?


Mac
